title: Sir Secret
author: Sir Secret
content: HelloMy Bitfury B8 were working normally, i've moved em recently to a different place. when i try to connect to them via 192.168.1.** etc like i used to they are not connecting even tho they are connect to network, they are hashing, they are showing up mining on the pool, they can be connected via PuttY but when i try to log into them via browsers they do not connect like using a wrong websiteim sure of the ip (i check their ip on the router's page)  ... also i've tried to restart them, i've tried to install software on the sd ... nothing helped ..anyone know what the problem could be ? thank you.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Try using a different browser, also, make sure you disable any antivirus software running on your PC, since you mentioned that you were able to access them in the previous site, I suggest you stop troubleshooting in the miners' direction and rather focus on the PC's direction, does your router have wireless connection? if so, try to access them using a mobile phone to access the miner.Quotei try to connect to them via 192.168.1.** etc like i used to they are not connectingTry typing the following instead.Code:http://192.168.1.**

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I think it's due to the browser's latest security protection which is why you can't able to access it.Using another device or browser might work as suggested above but if it didn't work try to download a low version or install internet explorer.If it didn't work even on the phone you can try to install the old version of opera mini or chrome with version v74.0.3729.169.

comments.author: Sir Secret
comments.body: Quote from: mikeywith on March 18, 2023, 10:37:13 PMTry using a different browser, also, make sure you disable any antivirus software running on your PC, since you mentioned that you were able to access them in the previous site, I suggest you stop troubleshooting in the miners' direction and rather focus on the PC's direction, does your router have wireless connection? if so, try to access them using a mobile phone to access the miner.Quotei try to connect to them via 192.168.1.** etc like i used to they are not connectingTry typing the following instead.Code:http://192.168.1.**ty for answeri've tried different browsers, i've tried to connect on via mobile and laptop too but sadly no luck

comments.author: Sir Secret
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on March 18, 2023, 11:47:02 PMI think it's due to the browser's latest security protection which is why you can't able to access it.Using another device or browser might work as suggested above but if it didn't work try to download a low version or install internet explorer.If it didn't work even on the phone you can try to install the old version of opera mini or chrome with version v74.0.3729.169.ty i will try to see the broswers old version cuz i've tried everything else

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: Sir Secret on March 19, 2023, 04:42:39 AMty i will try to see the broswers old version cuz i've tried everything else If nothing works even if you use the older version of the browser your last hope is to flash the unit through SD card flashing.Bitfury support page has this firmware you can find it here below.- https://bitfury.com/crypto-infrastructure/supportThe guide on how to flash also can be found under their manual.Do you mind to test before you flash it if you can able to access it through putty/ssh?

comments.author: Sir Secret
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on March 19, 2023, 03:28:23 PMQuote from: Sir Secret on March 19, 2023, 04:42:39 AMty i will try to see the broswers old version cuz i've tried everything else If nothing works even if you use the older version of the browser your last hope is to flash the unit through SD card flashing.Bitfury support page has this firmware you can find it here below.- https://bitfury.com/crypto-infrastructure/supportThe guide on how to flash also can be found under their manual.Do you mind to test before you flash it if you can able to access it through putty/ssh?I,ve tried everything mentioned along with new software on sd its not only 1 machine problem its all of them Yes i can connect with PuttY But i dunno what commands to use to fix this issue

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: Sir Secret on March 19, 2023, 04:21:48 PMI,ve tried everything mentioned along with new software on sd its not only 1 machine problem its all of them Yes i can connect with PuttY But i dunno what commands to use to fix this issue Is it possible that your router's firewall is blocking the connection to the miner for whatever reason? do you have another router to test with? if not, you can just connect the miner directly to one of the miners, follow my step-by-step guide, and keep updating the topic, your problem is interesting, to say the least.

comments.author: Sir Secret
comments.body: thanx everyone i've managed to fix it after i tried everything and almost pull my hair out lolthe problem was in the router's DNS settings its using a default DNS that does not work anymore for mining and miners  and i changed it to google's DNS thank you all for trying to help
